intro: Polycarpaea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Polycarpaea parviflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
